questions.text: Not included in primary survey in TRIAGE is?

questions.text: Which one of the following statement is false regarding cricothyroidotomy?

questions.text: A 25 years old male sustained a sharp injury in right groin, which bled in pulsatile fashion. After 15 mins in emergency room his bleeding has stopped with pressure dressing but at right groin there is an expanding hematoma. Further management of this patient should be?

options.text: Debridement and repair with an interposition prosthetic graft

options.text: Debridement and repair with an interposition arterial graft

questions.correct_answer: D. Debridement and repair with an interposition vein graft

False statement about abdominal trauma is?

questions.text: A 25 year old male was brought to the casualty after road traffic accident with pelvic fracture in hypovolemic shock. What is the earliest treatment for control of haemorrhage?

questions.text: Which of the following is least likely seen in flexion distraction lap belt injury?

A 20 year old man met with an cycle accident when handle of cycle hit his lower abdomen. He was brought to hospital next day with pain lower abdomen. He has not passed urine since he sustained trauma. On examination no bladder lump could be palpated and there is diffuse tenderness in lower abdomen. Ultrasound revealed a partially full bladder with free fluid in abdomen. Cystogram picture is given below. What is the ideal treatment for this patient?

options.label: A
options.text: Pass a foleys catheter and leave the catheter for 2 weeks

options.label: B
options.text: Immediate surgery and repair of Intraperitoneal bladder rupture with absorbable suture

options.label: C
options.text: Immediate surgery and repair of extraperitoneal bladder rupture with absorbable suture

options.label: D
options.text: Immediate surgery and repair of extraperitoneal bladder rupture with non- absorbable suture

questions.correct_answer: B. Immediate surgery and repair of Intraperitoneal bladder rupture with absorbable suture

questions.text: In retroperitoneal haematomas . which one of the following statements is true ?

options.label: A

options.label: B
options.text: All zone 1 vascular injuries should be managed with embolization

options.label: C
options.text: Zone 2 blunt injuries with expanding haematoma should be explored surgically

options.text: Mattox manoeuvre is when the ascending colon is mobilized to expose the IVC

questions.correct_answer: C. Zone 2 blunt injuries with expanding haematoma should be explored surgically

questions.text: A 22 year old patient was admitted with history of trauma and left chest pain, left upper abdominal pain and tenderness with stable vitals. options.label: B
options.text: Retrograde flow in vertebral artery of the contralateral side

questions.correct_answer: B. Retrograde flow in vertebral artery of the contralateral side

On examination the swelling moves up with swallowing, it is smooth, firm and not tender. USG showed smooth (Non nodular) thyroid enlargement. In investigation his T3 and T4 were high and TSH low. options.label: B
